Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the capabilities of the satellite by stating that it will provide free internet access to all Myanmar citizens when it will only be used for satellite imaging purposes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the satellite will provide free internet access.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the satellite's purpose is to provide free internet access, but the expert's verdict clarifies that it is actually an earth observation satellite.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the satellite will not provide any internet access, as stated by Dr. Kyi Thwin, the Rector of Myanmar Aerospace Engineering University.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for the satellite's purpose, stating that it will be used for urban planning, transportation, weather forecasting, and agriculture purposes.
